com.polarion.alm.projects

Interface IProjectService


  • public interface IProjectService
    The root service to manage projects. This component provides ways to create, modify and delete projects.

    In some environments, project creation and deletion might not be supported, because they are controlled by other means. If so, the getLifecycleManager() will return null.

    Author:
    dobisekm

      • getUser

        IUser getUser(java.lang.String userId)
        Returns the user with the given id.
        Returns:
        the unresolved IPObject with the given id. The operation is performed using only the ids, so it is not guaranteed that such a user actually exists and will be resolvable. Never returns null.

      • getUserAvatarURL

        java.lang.String getUserAvatarURL(java.lang.String userId)
        Returns a user avatar image URL. Can be the user's uploaded image, a reference to an external image or the default image. The URL may be absolute, or relative to the portal's base URL. The user can be unresolvable, or not yet persisted. The user id can also be null.
        Parameters:
        userId - id of a user or null
        Returns:
        avatar URL, never null
        Since:
        3.6.0

      • getCurrentUser

        IUser getCurrentUser()
        Consults ISecurityService to identify the user-id executing this code and transforms the id into the (unresolved) IUser object.

        Note: the resulting IUser is not guaranteed to be resolvable.

        Returns:
        the current user or null if there is no subject executing this code.

      • getUsers

        IPObjectList getUsers()
        Returns:
        a list of everyone registered in the system IUser

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getUsersNotInProject

        IPObjectList getUsersNotInProject(IProject project)
        Parameters:
        project -
        Returns:
        a list of users that do not belong to a specified project IUser In other words it returns a list of all users except the users returned by getProjectUsers().

      • searchProjectUsers

        IPObjectList searchProjectUsers(IProject project,
                                java.lang.String query,
                                java.lang.String sort)
        Returns:
        a list of users found in the project IUser. It is significantly slower than getProjectUsers, so use it only when needed.

      • searchUsers

        IPObjectList searchUsers(java.lang.String query)
        Returns:
        a list of all users found in the system. IUser

      • getProject

        IProject getProject(java.lang.String projectId)
        Returns:
        the unresolved IPObject with the given id. The operation is performed just with the ids, so it is not guaranteed, that such a project really exists and will be resolvable. Never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if projectId is null

      • getGroupEntityAtLocation

        IGroupEntity getGroupEntityAtLocation(ILocation loc)
        Returns the IGroupEntity (a IProject or IProjectGroup), that exactly matches the given location. Returns null if the location does not match any group entity (even if it lies INSIDE of the entity).
        Parameters:
        loc - The Location, might be null (= root group).
        See Also:
        getGroupEntityOwningLocation(ILocation), getProjectAtLocation(ILocation), getProjectGroupAtLocation(ILocation)

      • getGroupEntityOwningLocation

        IGroupEntity getGroupEntityOwningLocation(ILocation loc)
        Similar to getGroupEntityAtLocation(ILocation), but returns the entity even if the given location lies inside that entity.
        Parameters:
        loc - the Location, might be null (= root group).
        Returns:
        the group entity owning the location. Never returns null, since even a completely nonexistent location is still owned by the ROOT group.
        See Also:
        getGroupEntityAtLocation(ILocation), getProjectOwningLocation(ILocation), getProjectGroupOwningLocation(ILocation)

      • getGroupEntityForContextId

        IGroupEntity getGroupEntityForContextId(IContextId contextId)
        Returns the IGroupEntity (a IProject or IProjectGroup) representing the given context.
        Parameters:
        contextId -
        Returns:
        IGroupEntity (a IProject or IProjectGroup), never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contextId is null or no such context exists.
        See Also:
        getProjectForContextId(IContextId), getProjectGroupForContextId(IContextId)

      • getProjectAtLocation

        IProject getProjectAtLocation(ILocation loc)
        Returns the project located at the given location. Returns null if the location does not map to a project or if it maps to IProjectGroup.
        Parameters:
        loc - the Location, might be null (= root group).
        Returns:
        the project or null
        See Also:
        getProjectOwningLocation(ILocation), getGroupEntityAtLocation(ILocation), getProjectGroupAtLocation(ILocation)

      • getProjectOwningLocation

        IProject getProjectOwningLocation(ILocation loc)
        Returns the project located at or above a given location. Returns null if the location lies inside (inclusive) of a project.
        Parameters:
        loc - the Location, might be null (= root group).
        Returns:
        the project or null
        See Also:
        getProjectAtLocation(ILocation), getGroupEntityAtLocation(ILocation), getProjectGroupAtLocation(ILocation)

      • getProjectForContextId

        @Nullable
IProject getProjectForContextId(IContextId contextId)
        Returns the IProject representing the given context or null if the context represents a project group.
        Parameters:
        contextId -
        Returns:
        IProject or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contextId is null or no such context exists.
        See Also:
        getGroupEntityForContextId(IContextId), getProjectGroupForContextId(IContextId)

      • getProjectGroupAtLocation

        IProjectGroup getProjectGroupAtLocation(ILocation loc)
        Returns the project group located at the given location. Returns null if the location does not map to a project group (e.g. if it maps to a project).
        Parameters:
        loc - the Location, might be null (= root group).
        Returns:
        the project group or null
        See Also:
        getProjectGroupOwningLocation(ILocation), getGroupEntityAtLocation(ILocation), getProjectAtLocation(ILocation)

      • getProjectGroupOwningLocation

        IProjectGroup getProjectGroupOwningLocation(ILocation loc)
        Returns the project group that contains the given location. Even if the location lies inside the project in this group, the group is still returned.
        Parameters:
        loc - the Location, might be null (= root group).
        Returns:
        the project group. Never returns null, since even the weirdest location is still owned by the Root group.
        See Also:
        getProjectGroupAtLocation(ILocation), getGroupEntityOwningLocation(ILocation), getProjectOwningLocation(ILocation)

      • getProjectGroupForContextId

        IProjectGroup getProjectGroupForContextId(IContextId contextId)
        Returns the IProjectGroup representing the given context or null if the context represents a project.
        Parameters:
        contextId -
        Returns:
        IProjectGroup or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contextId is null or no such context exists.
        See Also:
        getGroupEntityForContextId(IContextId), getProjectForContextId(IContextId)

      • getProjectGroupForPath

        @NotNull
IProjectGroup getProjectGroupForPath(@Nullable
                                              java.lang.String projectGroupPath)
        Returns the IProjectGroup, that contains the location created from the given path. Even if the location lies inside the project in this group, the group is still returned.
        Parameters:
        path - the group path to create the appropriate location
        Returns:
        the project group. Never returns null, since even the weirdest location is still owned by the Root group.
        Since:
        3.10.1
        See Also:
        getProjectGroupAtLocation(ILocation), getGroupEntityOwningLocation(ILocation), getProjectOwningLocation(ILocation)

      • getLDAPUserSynchronization

        ILDAPUserSynchronization getLDAPUserSynchronization()

      • login

        javax.security.auth.Subject login(java.lang.String userId,
                                  java.lang.String credentials,
                                  java.lang.String source)
                           throws AuthenticationFailedException,
                                  LoginDeniedException
        This is the higher level wrapper for ISecurityService.login(String, String, String). A user object with the given id must exist for a successful login, however it can be auto created as a part of the call of this method. (If auto creation is configured appropriately). Must NOT be called within a transaction.
        Parameters:
        userId -
        credentials -
        source -
        Returns:
        authenticated subject (not null)
        Throws:
        AuthenticationFailedException
        LoginDeniedException
        See Also:
        ISecurityService.login(String, String, String)

      • loginWithToken

        @NotNull
javax.security.auth.Subject loginWithToken(@NotNull
                                                    java.lang.String token,
                                                    @NotNull
                                                    java.lang.String source)
                                             throws AuthenticationFailedException
        This is the higher level wrapper for ISecurityService.loginWithToken(String, String). A User object with the given id must exist to log in successfully, but can be auto created as a part of this method's call. (If auto creation is configured appropriately). It must NOT be called within a transaction.

        To have Teamcenter Security Services (TCSS) login with a token, you need to first use the following method to create a Base64 encoded token TcssToken.create(String, String).

        Alternatively, to use Kerberos/SPNEGO to login, you need to encode a token into Base64 and then pass it directly.

        Parameters:
        token - the token used for validation. Cannot be null. The token must be encoded using the Base64 encoding scheme.
        source - the login source (e.g. "portal/IP" or "system") - Used only for logging.
        Returns:
        Authenticated subject (not null).
        Throws:
        AuthenticationFailedException - If the given token is not valid or if the user does not exist in the system and auto creation is not enabled. It also throws an exception if a user does not have the sufficient permissions to log in.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the mechanism, token or source are null.
        Since:
        3.17.0
        See Also:
        ISecurityService#login(String, String)

      • hasBeenModifiedSince

        java.lang.String hasBeenModifiedSince(java.lang.String revision)
        Useful for the invalidation of some project caches. Inspired by the if-modified-since feature of the http protocol.
        Parameters:
        revision - the last revision seen by the client (revision of its cached data) or null if not known.
        Returns:
        null if data in the related projects has not been changed since, or a new revision of project related data signals that the client has to invalidate its caches.
        Since:
        3.7.3
